content.question: A hypothetical spherical planet of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is made of a uniform substance and has a gravitational field <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math> at its surface. Suppose eight of these identical planets collide and combine into a new uniform, spherical planet. What will the gravitational field on the surface of this new planet be in terms of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>g</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
